Open Steno Project

☰ Blog   Community About Donate

What is Open Steno?

Open

We are freeing stenography in an industry that is locked down, proprietary, and expensive.

Free

Open Steno is run by volunteers. Traditionally, getting started with steno cost thousands of dollars. We enable anyone to learn stenography for free.

Learn More

Learn more about us and our mission on our About Page.

What is Stenography?

Fast

Court reporters have used stenography for over a century to write at over 200 words per minute, faster than most people speak.

Ergonomic

Stenographers stroke chords instead of typing keys, resulting in less movement and better ergonomics than typing.

Flexible

Steno chords can map to words, phrases, symbols, emoji, macros, and more.

Software

Meet Plover

Plover is a 100% free, open source steno program that lets you use your keyboard as a steno machine.

Get Started

See our wiki page on how to get started with Plover.

Demo

Try an in-browser demo to see what stenography is like.

Hardware

Affordable

Professional steno machines cost thousands of dollars. The Open Steno community has introduced affordable beginner options.

Key Toppers

The cheapest options are replacement key caps or laser-cut pads for N-key rollover keyboards.

Open Source

Hobbyist steno machines are designed and sold by members of the community.

Learn

Learn Plover

Learn Plover, a free online textbook that teaches the reader Plover’s machine shorthand theory.

Steno Arcade

A free typing game on Steam where you type lyrics in time with the singer.

Self-teach

The community has collected and created many free learning resources so that you don’t have to go to school to become a stenographer.

Start Today
